alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 21 at 2:30PM MDT until October 23 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...West and southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From 6 AM Saturday to 6 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs may be blown down. Expect strong crosswinds on area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are expected along east-facing slopes of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains where mountain waves result in periodic and erratic gusts up to 50 mph. Large trees that were severely burned during the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon fire will be especially susceptible to being blown down.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains
